gurmukhi: kwnih kY fr qy hm cor kY rwKq hY cV aUc AtwrI ] aUKl ko Dir kY mnhw pr Kwq hY lMgr dy kir gwrI ]124]
transliteration: Kaanah(i) Kai Dar Te Ham Chor Kai Raakhat Hai Chad Ooch Atdaree|| Ookhal Ko Dhar(i) Kai Manhaa Par Khaat Hai Lanad De Kar(i) Gdaree||124||
translation: “Because of the fear of Krishna, we keep the butter at a higher place, but still he, with the support of mortars, gets high up and abusing us eats the butter alongwith other children.”124.

gurmukhi: hoq nhI ijhky Gir mY dD dY kir gwrn Sor krY hY ] jo lrkw jinkY iKJ hY jn qo iml sotn swQ mrY hY ]
transliteration: Hot Nahijihke Ghar(i) Mai Dadh Dai Kar(i) Gadran Shor Darai Hai|| Jo Larkaa Jan(i)kai Khijh Hai Jan To Mil Sotan Saath Darai Hai||
translation: “O Yashoda ! The person in whose house they do not get butter, there they raising noises, call bad names; if someone gets angry with them, considering them as boys, they then beat him with their clubs;

gurmukhi: Awie prY ju qRIAw iqh pY isr kY iqh bwr auKwr frY hY ] bwq suno jsuDw suq kI su ibnw auqpwq nw kwnH trY hY ]125]
transliteration: Ooe Darai Ju Treeaa Tih Pai Sir Kai Tih Baar Oukhaar Darai Hai|| Baat Souno Jasudhaa Sout Kibinaa Outpaat Naa Kahn Darai Hai||125||
translation: “Besides this if some woman comes and tries to reprimand them, then they all pull down her hair and O Yashoda ! Listen to the behavious of your son, he does not comply without conflict.”125.

gurmukhi: bwq sunI jb gopn kI jsuDw qb hI mn mwih iKJI hY ] Awie gXo hir jI qb hI ipK puqiH kO mn mwih irJI hY ]
transliteration: Baat Sounijab Gopan Kijasudhaa Tab Himan Maah(i) Khijhihai|| Ooe Gado Har(i0 Jitab Hipikh Poutrah(i) Kau Man Maah(i) Rijhihai||
translation: Hearing the words of the gopis, Yashoda became angry in her mind, but when Krishna came home, she was delighted to see him;

gurmukhi: bol auTy nMd lwl qbY ieh gÍwr iKJwvn moih igJI hY ] mwq khw dD doS lgwvq mwr ibnw nwih isJI hY ]126]
transliteration: Bol Outhe Nand Laal Tabai Eh Gvaar Khijhaavan Moh(i) Gijhihai|| Maat Kahaa Dadh Dosh Lagadvat Maar Binaa Eh Naah(i) Sijhihai||126||
translation: Krishna said on coming, “These milkmaids annoy me very much, they are blaming me only for curd, they will not get right without beating.”126.

gurmukhi: mwq khXo Apny suq kO khu ikau kir qoih iKJwvq gopI ] mwq soN bwq khI suq XO kir so gih Bwgq hY muih topI ]
transliteration: Maat Kahyo Apme Sout Kau Kaho Kio Kar(i) Tohe Khijhaavat Gopee|| Maat Son Baat Kahisout You Kar(i) So Gadh Bhaagad Hai Muhe Topee||
translation: The mother asked the son, “Alright son ! Tell me, hoe do these gopis annoy you?” Then the son said to the mother, “They all run away with my cap,

gurmukhi: fwrkY nws ibKY AMgurI isr mwrq hYN muJ kO vh QopI ] nwk Gswie hswie aunY iPr lyq qbY vh dyq hY topI ]127]
transliteration: Daar-kai Naas Bikhai Anurisir Maarat Hain Mujh Kau Vah Thopee|| Naak Ghasaae Hasaae Hasaae Ounai Phir Let Tabai Vah Det Hai Topt||127||
translation: “They close my nose, strike my head and then return my cap after getting my nose rubbed and after making mockery of me.”127.
Speech of Yashoda addressed to gopis:

gurmukhi: mwq iKJI aun gopn ko qum ikau suq moih iKJwvq hau rI ] bolq ho Apny muK qy hmry Dn hY dD dwm su gaurI ]
transliteration: Maat Khijhioun Gopan Ko Toum Kio Sout Mohe Khijhaavat Hau Ree|| Dolat Ho Apne Moukh E Hamre Dhan Hai Dadh Daam Su Gadddee||
translation: The mother Yashoda said angrily to those gopis, “Why do you annoy my child? You are bragging with your mouth that the curd, cow and wealth is only in your house and none other has got them;

gurmukhi: mUV AhIr n jwnq hY bf bolq ho su rho qum TaurI ] kwnih swD ibnw AprwDih bolih gI ju BeI kCu baurI ]128]
transliteration: Moond Aheer Na Jaanat Hai Bad Dolat Ho Su Raho Toum Thauree|| Kaanah(i) Saadh Binaa Apraadhah(i) Boleh Giju Bhaikachh(u) Bauree||128||
translation: “O foolish milkmaids ! you continue to speak without thinking, stay here and I shall set you right; Krishna is very simple, if you will say anything to him without any fault, you will be considered mad.”128.

gurmukhi: ibnqI kY jsuDw qbY doaU dey imlwie ] kwnH ibgwrY syr dD lyhu mnk qum Awie ]129]
transliteration: Bintikai Jasudhaa Tabai Dooo Dae Milaae|| Kaahn Bigdarai Ser Dadh Lehu Manak Toum Aae||129||
translation: Then Yashoda instructed both Krishna and gopis and caused peace for both the parties; she said to gopis, “If Krishna soils one seer of your milk, you come and take a maund from me.”129.
Speech of gopis addressed to Yashoda:
